x-enum-elements.name: BUYER_CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: A person canceled the `TerminalCheckout` from a Square device.

x-enum-elements.name: SELLER_CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: A client canceled the `TerminalCheckout` using the API.

x-enum-elements.name: TIMED_OUT
x-enum-elements.description: The `TerminalCheckout` timed out (see `deadline_duration` on the `TerminalCheckout`).

x-enum-elements.name: VERIFICATION_IN_PROGRESS
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the verification process has started. Some features
(for example, creditable or debitable) may be provisionally enabled on the bank
account.

x-enum-elements.name: VERIFIED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the bank account was successfully verified.

x-enum-elements.name: DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the bank account is disabled and is permanently unusable
for funds transfer. A bank account can be disabled because of a failed verification
attempt or a failed deposit attempt.

BankAccountStatus.description: Indicates the current verification status of a `BankAccount` object.

x-enum-elements.name: CHECKING
x-enum-elements.description:
An account at a financial institution against which checks can be
drawn by the account depositor.

x-enum-elements.name: SAVINGS
x-enum-elements.description:
An account at a financial institution that pays interest but cannot be
used directly as money in the narrow sense of a medium of exchange.

x-enum-elements.name: INVESTMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
An account at a financial institution that contains a deposit of funds
and/or securities.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description:
An account at a financial institution which cannot be described by the
other types.

x-enum-elements.name: BUSINESS_CHECKING
x-enum-elements.description:
An account at a financial institution against which checks can be
drawn specifically for business purposes (non-personal use).

BankAccountType.description: Indicates the financial purpose of the bank account.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: An unaccepted booking. It is visible to both sellers and customers.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLED_BY_CUSTOMER
x-enum-elements.description: A customer-cancelled booking. It is visible to both the seller and the customer.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLED_BY_SELLER
x-enum-elements.description: A seller-cancelled booking. It is visible to both the seller and the customer.

x-enum-elements.name: DECLINED
x-enum-elements.description: A declined booking. It had once been pending, but was then declined by the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCEPTED
x-enum-elements.description: An accepted booking agreed to or accepted by the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_SHOW
x-enum-elements.description:
A no-show booking. The booking was accepted at one time, but have now been marked as a no-show by
the seller because the client either missed the booking or cancelled it without enough notice.

x-enum-elements.name: SERVICE_DURATION
x-enum-elements.description: The service duration unit is one visit of a fixed time interval specified by the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: QUARTER_HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The service duration unit is a 15-minute interval. Bookings can be scheduled every quarter hour.

x-enum-elements.name: HALF_HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The service duration unit is a 30-minute interval. Bookings can be scheduled every half hour.

x-enum-elements.name: HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The service duration unit is a 60-minute interval. Bookings can be scheduled every hour.

BusinessAppointmentSettingsAlignmentTime.description: Time units of a service duration for bookings.

x-enum-elements.name: BUSINESS_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description: The service is provided at a seller location.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description: The service is provided at a customer location.

x-enum-elements.name: PHONE
x-enum-elements.description: The service is provided over the phone.

BusinessAppointmentSettingsBookingLocati.description: Types of location where service is provided.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLATION_TREATED_AS_NO_SHOW
x-enum-elements.description: Cancellations are treated as no shows and may incur a fee as specified by `cancellation_fee_money`.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM_POLICY
x-enum-elements.description: Cancellations follow the seller-specified policy that is described in free-form text and not enforced automatically by Square.

BusinessAppointmentSettingsCancellationP.description: The category of the sellers cancellation policy.

x-enum-elements.name: PER_TEAM_MEMBER
x-enum-elements.description: The maximum number of daily appointments is set on a per team member basis.

x-enum-elements.name: PER_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description: The maximum number of daily appointments is set on a per location basis.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCEPT_ALL
x-enum-elements.description: The seller accepts all booking requests automatically.

x-enum-elements.name: REQUIRES_ACCEPTANCE
x-enum-elements.description: The seller must accept requests to complete bookings.

x-enum-elements.name: BUSINESS_LOCATION_TIMEZONE
x-enum-elements.description: Use the time zone of the business location for bookings.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_CHOICE
x-enum-elements.description: Use the customer-chosen time zone for bookings.

BusinessBookingProfileCustomerTimezoneCh.description: Choices of customer-facing time zone used for bookings.

CardBrand.description: Indicates a card's brand, such as `VISA` or `MASTERCARD`.

CardPrepaidType.description: Indicates a card's prepaid type, such as `NOT_PREPAID` or `PREPAID`.

CardType.description: Indicates a card's type, such as `CREDIT` or `DEBIT`.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_SALE
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a no sale occurs on a cash drawer.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must have a zero money amount.

x-enum-elements.name: CASH_TENDER_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a cash tender payment occurs on a cash drawer.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type can must not have a negative amount.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TENDER_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a check, gift card, or other non-cash payment occurs
on a cash drawer.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must have a zero money amount.

x-enum-elements.name: CASH_TENDER_CANCELLED_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a split tender bill is cancelled after cash has been
tendered.
A CASH_TENDER_CANCELLED_PAYMENT should have a corresponding CASH_TENDER_PAYMENT.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must not have a negative amount.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TENDER_CANCELLED_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a split tender bill is cancelled after a non-cash tender
has been tendered. An OTHER_TENDER_CANCELLED_PAYMENT should have a corresponding
OTHER_TENDER_PAYMENT. A CashDrawerEvent of this type must have a zero money
amount.

x-enum-elements.name: CASH_TENDER_REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when a cash tender refund occurs.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must not have a negative amount.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TENDER_REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when an other tender refund occurs.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must have a zero money amount.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID_IN
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when money unrelated to a payment is added to the cash drawer.
For example, an employee adds coins to the drawer.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must not have a negative amount.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID_OUT
x-enum-elements.description:
Triggered when money is removed from the drawer for other reasons
than making change.
For example, an employee pays a delivery person with cash from the cash drawer.
A CashDrawerEvent of this type must not have a negative amount.

CashDrawerEventType.description:
The types of events on a CashDrawerShift.
Each event type represents an employee action on the actual cash drawer
represented by a CashDrawerShift.

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: An open cash drawer shift.

x-enum-elements.name: ENDED
x-enum-elements.description: A cash drawer shift that is ended but has not yet had an employee content audit.

x-enum-elements.name: CLOSED
x-enum-elements.description:
An ended cash drawer shift that is closed with a completed employee
content audit and recorded result.

CashDrawerShiftState.description: The current state of a cash drawer shift.

x-enum-elements.name: APP_VISIBILITY_HIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: Other applications cannot read this custom attribute.

x-enum-elements.name: APP_VISIBILITY_READ_ONLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Other applications can read this custom attribute definition and
values.

x-enum-elements.name: APP_VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES
x-enum-elements.description:
Other applications can read and write custom attribute values on objects.
They can read but cannot edit the custom attribute definition.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionAppVisib.description:
Defines the visibility of a custom attribute to applications other than their
creating application.

x-enum-elements.name: SELLER_VISIBILITY_HIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description:
Sellers cannot read this custom attribute in Square client
applications or Square APIs.

x-enum-elements.name: SELLER_VISIBILITY_READ_WRITE_VALUES
x-enum-elements.description:
Sellers can read and write this custom attribute value in catalog objects,
but cannot edit the custom attribute definition.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionSellerVi.description:
Defines the visibility of a custom attribute to sellers in Square
client applications, Square APIs or in Square UIs (including Square Point
of Sale applications and Square Dashboard).

x-enum-elements.name: STRING
x-enum-elements.description: A free-form string containing up to 255 characters.

x-enum-elements.name: BOOLEAN
x-enum-elements.description: A `true` or `false` value.

x-enum-elements.name: NUMBER
x-enum-elements.description: A decimal string representation of a number. Can support up to 5 digits after the decimal point.

x-enum-elements.name: SELECTION
x-enum-elements.description: One or more choices from `allowed_selections`.

CatalogCustomAttributeDefinitionType.description: Defines the possible types for a custom attribute.

x-enum-elements.name: MODIFY_TAX_BASIS
x-enum-elements.description: Application of the discount will modify the tax basis.

x-enum-elements.name: DO_NOT_MODIFY_TAX_BASIS
x-enum-elements.description: Application of the discount will not modify the tax basis.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed percentage (e.g., 5%) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed amount (e.g., $1.00) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a variable percentage off the item price. The percentage will be specified at the time of sale.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a variable amount off the item price. The amount will be specified at the time of sale.

CatalogDiscountType.description: How to apply a CatalogDiscount to a CatalogItem.

x-enum-elements.name: REGULAR
x-enum-elements.description: An ordinary item.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: A Square gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: APPOINTMENTS_SERVICE
x-enum-elements.description: A service that can be booked using the Square Appointments app.

CatalogItemProductType.description: The type of a CatalogItem. Connect V2 only allows the creation of `REGULAR` or `APPOINTMENTS_SERVICE` items.

x-enum-elements.name: SINGLE
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that a CatalogModifierList allows only a
single CatalogModifier to be selected.

x-enum-elements.name: MULTIPLE
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that a CatalogModifierList allows multiple
CatalogModifier to be selected.

CatalogModifierListSelectionType.description: Indicates whether a CatalogModifierList supports multiple selections.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
An item, corresponding to `CatalogItem`. The item-specific data
will be stored in the `item_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: IMAGE
x-enum-elements.description:
An image, corresponding to `CatalogImage`. The image-specific data
will be stored in the `image_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description:
A category, corresponding to `CatalogCategory`. The category-specific data
will be stored in the `category_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An item variation, corresponding to `CatalogItemVariation`. The
item variation-specific data will be stored in the `item_variation_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: TAX
x-enum-elements.description:
A tax, corresponding to `CatalogTax`. The tax-specific data
will be stored in the `tax_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: DISCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
A discount, corresponding to `CatalogDiscount`. The discount-specific data
will be stored in the `discount_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: MODIFIER_LIST
x-enum-elements.description:
A modifier list, corresponding to `CatalogModifierList`.
The modifier list-specific data will be stored in the `modifier_list_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: MODIFIER
x-enum-elements.description:
A modifier, corresponding to `CatalogModifier`. The modifier-specific data
will be stored in the `modifier_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: PRICING_RULE
x-enum-elements.description:
A pricing rule, corresponding to `CatalogPricingRule`. The pricing-rule-specific data
will be stored in the `pricing_rule_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: PRODUCT_SET
x-enum-elements.description:
A product set, corresponding to `CatalogProductSet`.
The product-set-specific data will be stored in the `product_set_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: TIME_PERIOD
x-enum-elements.description:
A time period, corresponding to `CatalogTimePeriod`.
The time-period-specific data will be stored in the `time_period_data` field.

x-enum-elements.name: MEASUREMENT_UNIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A measurement unit, corresponding to `CatalogMeasurementUnit`. The unit of
measure and precision in which an item variation should be sold.

x-enum-elements.name: SUBSCRIPTION_PLAN
x-enum-elements.description:
A subscription plan, corresponding to
[CatalogSubscriptionPlan](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/CatalogSubscriptionPlan).

The subscription plan data is stored in the `subscription_plan_data` field of the
[CatalogObject](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/CatalogObject).

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_OPTION
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents a list of item option values that can be assigned to item
variations. For example, a color option or size option for a t-shirt.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_OPTION_VAL
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents an option value associated with one or more item options.
For example, an item option of "Size" may have item option values such as
"Small" or "Medium".

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE_DEFINITION
x-enum-elements.description: Represents the definition of a custom attribute

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNTS_SETTINGS
x-enum-elements.description:
Represents a set of Quick Amounts and their settings at each location.
For example, a location may have a list of both AUTO and MANUAL quick amounts that are set to DISABLED.

CatalogObjectType.description:
Possible types of CatalogObjects returned from the Catalog, each
containing type-specific properties in the `*_data` field corresponding to the object type.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PRICING
x-enum-elements.description: The catalog item variation's price is fixed.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PRICING
x-enum-elements.description: The catalog item variation's price is entered at the time of sale.

CatalogPricingType.description: Indicates whether the price of a CatalogItemVariation should be entered manually at the time of sale.

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNT_TYPE_MANUAL
x-enum-elements.description: Quick Amount is created manually by the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: QUICK_AMOUNT_TYPE_AUTO
x-enum-elements.description: Quick Amount is generated automatically by machine learning algorithms.

CatalogQuickAmountType.description: Determines the type of a specific Quick Amount.

x-enum-elements.name: DISABLED
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to disable Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUAL
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose manually created Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTO
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose automatically created Quick Amounts.

CatalogQuickAmountsSettingsOption.description: Determines a seller's option on Quick Amounts feature.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_PRESENT
x-enum-elements.description: Accept credit card or debit card payments via tap, dip or swipe.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUAL_CARD_ENTRY
x-enum-elements.description: Launches the manual credit or debit card entry screen for the buyer to complete.

x-enum-elements.name: FELICA_ID
x-enum-elements.description: Launches the iD checkout screen for the buyer to complete.

x-enum-elements.name: FELICA_QUICPAY
x-enum-elements.description: Launches the QUICPay checkout screen for the buyer to complete.

x-enum-elements.name: FELICA_TRANSPORTATION_GROUP
x-enum-elements.description: Launches the Transportation Group checkout screen for the buyer to complete.

x-enum-elements.name: FELICA_ALL
x-enum-elements.description:
Launches a checkout screen for the buyer on the Square Terminal that
allows them to select a specific FeliCa brand or select the check balance screen.

Currency.description:
Indicates the associated currency for an amount of money. Values correspond
to [ISO 4217](https://wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217).

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description:
The default creation source. This source is typically used for backward/future
compatibility when the original source of a customer profile is
unrecognized. For example, when older clients do not support newer
source types.

x-enum-elements.name: APPOINTMENTS
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when an appointment
was scheduled.

x-enum-elements.name: COUPON
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when a coupon was issued
using Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: DELETION_RECOVERY
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was restored through Square's deletion recovery
process.

x-enum-elements.name: DIRECTORY
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created manually through Square Seller Dashboard or the 
Point of Sale application.

x-enum-elements.name: EGIFTING
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when a gift card was
issued using Square Point of Sale. Customer profiles are created for
both the buyer and the recipient of the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL_COLLECTION
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created through Square Point of Sale when
signing up for marketing emails during checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: FEEDBACK
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when providing feedback
through a digital receipt.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when importing customer
data through Square Seller Dashboard.

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICES
x-enum-elements.description: The customer profile was created automatically during an invoice payment.

x-enum-elements.name: LOYALTY
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically when customers provide a
phone number for loyalty reward programs during checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: MARKETING
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created as the result of a campaign managed
through Squares Facebook integration.

x-enum-elements.name: MERGE
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created as the result of explicitly merging
multiple customer profiles through the Square Seller Dashboard or the Point of
Sale application.

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_STORE
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created through Square's Online Store solution
(legacy service).

x-enum-elements.name: INSTANT_PROFILE
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created automatically as the result of a successful
transaction that did not explicitly link to an existing customer profile.

x-enum-elements.name: TERMINAL
x-enum-elements.description: The customer profile was created through Square's Virtual Terminal.

x-enum-elements.name: THIRD_PARTY
x-enum-elements.description: The customer profile was created through a Square API call.

x-enum-elements.name: THIRD_PARTY_IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was created by a third-party product and imported
through an official integration.

x-enum-elements.name: UNMERGE_RECOVERY
x-enum-elements.description:
The customer profile was restored through Square's unmerge recovery
process.

CustomerCreationSource.description: Indicates the method used to create the customer profile.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be included in the result set when they match the
filtering criteria.

x-enum-elements.name: EXCLUDE
x-enum-elements.description:
Customers should be excluded from the result set when they match
the filtering criteria.

CustomerInclusionExclusion.description:
Indicates whether customers should be included in, or excluded from,
the result set when they match the filtering criteria.

x-enum-elements.name: DEFAULT
x-enum-elements.description:
Use the default sort key. By default, customers are sorted
alphanumerically by concatenating their `given_name` and `family_name`. If
neither name field is set, string comparison is performed using one of the
remaining fields in the following order: `company_name`, `email`,
`phone_number`.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
x-enum-elements.description: Use the creation date attribute (`created_at`) of customer profiles as the sort key.

CustomerSortField.description: Specifies customer attributes as the sort key to customer profiles returned from a search.

DayOfWeek.description: Indicates the specific day  of the week.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN
x-enum-elements.description: The status cannot be determined or does not exist.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPAIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The device code is just created and unpaired.

x-enum-elements.name: PAIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The device code has been signed in and paired to a device.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The device code was unpaired and expired before it was paired.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_EVIDENCE
x-enum-elements.description:
Square assumes this evidence type if you do not provide a type when uploading evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: ONLINE_OR_APP_ACCESS_LOG
x-enum-elements.description:
Server or activity logs that show proof of the cardholders identity and that the
cardholder successfully ordered and received the goods (digitally or otherwise).
Example evidence includes IP addresses, corresponding timestamps/dates, cardholders name and email
address linked to a cardholder profile held by the seller, proof the same device and card (used
in dispute) were previously used in prior undisputed transaction, and any related detailed activity.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHORIZATION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder did provide authorization for the charge.
Example evidence includes a signed credit card authorization.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLATION_OR_REFUND_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the cardholder acknowledged your refund or cancellation policy.
Example evidence includes a signature or checkbox showing the cardholders acknowledgement of your
refund or cancellation policy.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_COMMUNICATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows relevant communication with the cardholder.
Example evidence includes emails or texts that show the cardholder received goods/services or
demonstrate cardholder satisfaction.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INFORMATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that validates the customer's identity.
Example evidence includes personally identifiable details such as name, email address, purchaser IP
address, and a copy of the cardholder ID.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: PURCHASE_ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows proof of the sale/transaction.
Example evidence includes an invoice, contract, or other item showing the customers acknowledgement
of the purchase and your terms.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE_CHARGE_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the charges in question are valid and distinct from one another.
Example evidence includes receipts, shipping labels, and invoices along with their distinct payment IDs.

Use when uploading evidence as a file.

x-enum-elements.name: PRODUCT_OR_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION
x-enum-elements.description:
A description of the product or service sold.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIPT
x-enum-elements.description:
A receipt or message sent to the cardholder detailing the charge.
Note: You do not need to upload the Square receipt; Square submits the receipt on your behalf.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: SERVICE_RECEIVED_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that the service was provided to the cardholder or the expected date that services will be rendered.
Example evidence includes a signed delivery form, work order, expected delivery date, or other written agreements.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: PROOF_OF_DELIVERY_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the product was provided to the cardholder or the expected date of delivery.
Example evidence includes a signed delivery form or written agreement acknowledging receipt of the goods or services.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: RELATED_TRANSACTION_DOCUMENTATION
x-enum-elements.description:
Evidence that shows the cardholder previously processed transactions on the same card and did not dispute them.
Note: Square automatically provides up to five distinct Square receipts for related transactions, when available.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: REBUTTAL_EXPLANATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An explanation of why the cardholders claim is invalid.
Example evidence includes an explanation of why each distinct charge is a legitimate purchase, why the cardholders claim
for credit owed due to their attempt to cancel, return, or refund is invalid per your stated policy and cardholder
agreement, or an explanation of how the cardholder did not attempt to remedy the issue with you first to receive credit.

Use when uploading evidence as a file or string.

x-enum-elements.name: TRACKING_NUMBER
x-enum-elements.description:
The tracking number for the order provided by the shipping carrier. If you have multiple numbers, they need to be
submitted individually as separate pieces of evidence.

Use when uploading evidence as a string.

DisputeEvidenceType.description: The type of the dispute evidence.

x-enum-elements.name: AMOUNT_DIFFERS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged the wrong amount for the purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that the cardholder agreed
to the amount charged.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELLED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they attempted to return the goods or cancel the service.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder
is not due a refund and that the cardholder acknowledged your cancellation policy.

x-enum-elements.name: DUPLICATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they were charged twice for the same purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are
legitimate and independent of one another.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_KNOWLEDGE
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they did not make this purchase nor authorized the charge.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that proves that the cardholder
identity was verified at the time of purchase and that the purchase was authorized.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_AS_DESCRIBED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was provided, but the quality of the deliverable
did not align with the expectations of the cardholder based on the description.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows the cardholder is in
possession of the product as described or received the service as described and agreed on.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_RECEIVED
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims the product or service was not received by the cardholder within the
stated time frame.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is
in possession of or received the product or service sold.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID_BY_OTHER_MEANS
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that they previously paid for this purchase.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence that shows both charges are
legitimate and independent of one another or proof that you already provided a credit for the charge.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_REQUESTS_CREDIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The cardholder claims that the purchase was canceled or returned, but they have not yet received
the credit.
To challenge this dispute, provide specific and concrete evidence to prove that the cardholder is not
due a refund and that they acknowledged your cancellation and/or refund policy.

x-enum-elements.name: EMV_LIABILITY_SHIFT
x-enum-elements.description:
A chip-enabled card was not processed through a compliant chip-card reader (for example, it was swiped
instead of dipped into a chip-card reader).
You cannot challenge this dispute because the payment did not comply with EMV security requirements.
For more information, see [What Is EMV?](https://squareup.com/emv)

DisputeReason.description:
The list of possible reasons why a cardholder might initiate a
dispute with their bank.

DisputeState.description: The list of possible dispute states.

x-enum-elements.name: UNINDEXED
x-enum-elements.description: Item is not synced with Ecom (Weebly). This is the default state

x-enum-elements.name: UNAVAILABLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but is unavailable within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout

x-enum-elements.name: HIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: Option for seller to choose manually created Quick Amounts.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIBLE
x-enum-elements.description: Item is synced but available within Ecom (Weebly) and Online Checkout but is hidden from Ecom Store.

EcomVisibility.description: Determines item visibility in Ecom (Online Store) and Online Checkout.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Active state.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: Specifies that the employee is in the Inactive state.

EmployeeStatus.description: The status of the Employee being retrieved.

x-enum-elements.name: API_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred with the Connect API itself.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTHENTICATION_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An authentication error occurred. Most commonly, the request had
a missing, malformed, or otherwise invalid `Authorization` header.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_REQUEST_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
The request was invalid. Most commonly, a required parameter was
missing, or a provided parameter had an invalid value.

x-enum-elements.name: RATE_LIMIT_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
Your application reached the Connect API rate limit. Retry your
request after a while.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
An error occurred while processing a payment method. Most commonly,
the details of the payment method were invalid (such as a card's CVV
or expiration date).

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred while attempting to process a refund.

x-enum-elements.name: MERCHANT_SUBSCRIPTION_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: An error occurred when checking a merchant subscription status

ErrorCategory.description:
Indicates which high-level category of error has occurred during a
request to the Connect API.

x-enum-elements.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description: A general server error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: UNAUTHORIZED

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRED

x-enum-elements.name: ACCESS_TOKEN_REVOKED

x-enum-elements.name: CLIENT_DISABLED

x-enum-elements.name: FORBIDDEN
x-enum-elements.description: A general access error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_SCOPES

The provided access token does not have permission
to execute the requested action.

x-enum-elements.name: APPLICATION_DISABLED

The calling application was created prior to
2016-03-30 and is not compatible with v2 Square API calls.

x-enum-elements.name: V1_ACCESS_TOKEN

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_PROCESSING_NOT_ENABLED

x-enum-elements.name: MERCHANT_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_REQUEST

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAMETER

The request is missing a required path, query, or

x-enum-elements.name: INCORRECT_TYPE

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_TIME_RANGE

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_VALUE

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_QUERY_PARAMETER

x-enum-elements.name: CONFLICTING_PARAMETERS

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_JSON_BODY

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_SORT_ORDER

The provided sort order is not a valid key.

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_REGEX_MISMATCH

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_TOO_HIGH

x-enum-elements.name: VALUE_EMPTY

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG

x-enum-elements.name: ARRAY_EMPTY

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BOOLEAN

The endpoint expected the provided value to be a

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_INTEGER

The endpoint expected the provided value to be an

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_FLOAT

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_ARRAY

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_MAP

x-enum-elements.name: EXPECTED_BASE64_ENCODED_BYTE_ARRAY

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ARRAY_VALUE

One or more objects in the array does not match the

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENUM_VALUE

The provided static string is not valid for the

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FORM_VALUE

Only relevant for applications created prior to
2016-03-30. Indicates there was an error while parsing form values.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOMER_NOT_FOUND

x-enum-elements.name: ONE_INSTRUMENT_EXPECTED
x-enum-elements.description: A general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: NO_FIELDS_SET
x-enum-elements.description: A general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: TOO_MANY_MAP_ENTRIES
x-enum-elements.description: Too many entries in the map field.

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT

x-enum-elements.name: MAP_KEY_LENGTH_TOO_LONG
x-enum-elements.description: The length of one of the provided keys in the map is too long.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a date in the past.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_YEAR
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration year for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it indicates a year in the past or contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The expiration date for the payment card is invalid. For example,
it contains invalid characters.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_CARD_BRAND
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card provided is not from a supported issuer.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_ENTRY_METHOD
x-enum-elements.description: The entry method for the credit card (swipe, dip, tap) is not supported.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ENCRYPTED_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The encrypted card information is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CARD
x-enum-elements.description: The credit card cannot be validated based on the provided details.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_DECLINE
x-enum-elements.description:
Square received a decline without any additional information.
If the payment information seems correct, the buyer can contact their
issuer to ask for more information.

x-enum-elements.name: CVV_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the CVV value is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDRESS_VERIFICATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the postal code is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_ACCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The issuer was not able to locate the account on record.

x-enum-elements.name: CURRENCY_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description:
The currency associated with the payment is not valid for the provided
funding source. For example, a gift card funded in USD cannot be used to process
payments in GBP.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
x-enum-elements.description: The funding source has insufficient funds to cover the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account does not have the permissions to accept
this payment. For example, Square may limit which merchants are
allowed to receive gift card payments.

x-enum-elements.name: CARDHOLDER_INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has declined the transaction due to restrictions on where the card can be used.
For example, a gift card is limited to a single merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_LOCATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The Square account cannot take payments in the specified region.
A Square account can take payments only from the region where the account was created.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSACTION_LIMIT
x-enum-elements.description:
The card issuer has determined the payment amount is either too high or too low.
The API returns the error code mostly for credit cards (for example, the card reached
the credit limit). However, sometimes the issuer bank can indicate the error for debit
or prepaid cards (for example, card has insufficient funds).

x-enum-elements.name: VOICE_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the issuer requires voice authorization from the cardholder.

x-enum-elements.name: PAN_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The specified card number is invalid. For example, it is of
incorrect length or is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRATION_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description:
The card expiration date is either invalid or indicates that the
card is expired.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description:
The card is not supported either in the geographic region or by
the [merchant category code](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/locations-api#initialize-a-merchant-category-code) (MCC).

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_PIN
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the request because the PIN is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_PIN
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is missing a required PIN.

x-enum-elements.name: MISSING_ACCOUNT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: The payment is missing a required ACCOUNT_TYPE parameter.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_POSTAL_CODE
x-enum-elements.description: The postal code is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_FEES
x-enum-elements.description: The app_fee_money on a payment is too high.

x-enum-elements.name: MANUALLY_ENTERED_PAYMENT_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description: The card must be swiped, tapped, or dipped. Payments attempted by manually entering the card number are declined.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
x-enum-elements.description: Square declined the request because the payment amount exceeded the processing limit for this merchant.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
When a Gift Card is a payment source, you can allow taking a partial payment 
by adding the `accept_partial_authorization` parameter in the request. 
However, taking such a partial payment does not work if your request also includes 
`tip_money`, `app_fee_money`, or both. Square declines such payments and returns 
the `GIFT_CARD_AVAILABLE_AMOUNT` error. 
For more information, see 
[CreatePayment errors (additional information)](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/payments-api/error-codes#createpayment-errors-additional-information).

x-enum-elements.name: ACCOUNT_UNUSABLE
x-enum-elements.description: The account provided cannot carry out transactions.

x-enum-elements.name: BUYER_REFUSED_PAYMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Bank account rejected or was not authorized for the payment.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to update a delayed-capture payment that has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to cancel a delayed-capture payment that was already cancelled.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_CAPTURED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to capture a delayed-capture payment that was already captured.

x-enum-elements.name: DELAYED_TRANSACTION_FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: The application tried to update a delayed-capture payment that failed.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_TOKEN_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided card token (nonce) has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_TOKEN_USED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided card token (nonce) was already used to process payment.

x-enum-elements.name: AMOUNT_TOO_HIGH
x-enum-elements.description: The requested payment amount is too high for the provided payment source.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_INSTRUMENT_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: The API request references an unsupported instrument type/

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_AMOUNT_INVALID
x-enum-elements.description: The requested refund amount exceeds the amount available to refund.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_ALREADY_PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The payment already has a pending refund.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_NOT_REFUNDABLE
x-enum-elements.description:
The payment is not refundable. For example, a previous refund has
already been rejected and no new refunds can be accepted.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND_DECLINED
x-enum-elements.description: Request failed - The card issuer declined the refund.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_CARD_DATA
x-enum-elements.description: Generic error - the provided card data is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: SOURCE_USED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided source id was already used to create a card.

x-enum-elements.name: SOURCE_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided source id has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_LOYALTY_REWARD_TIER
x-enum-elements.description:
The referenced loyalty program reward tier is not supported.
This could happen if the reward tier created in a first party
application is incompatible with the Loyalty API.

x-enum-elements.name: LOCATION_MISMATCH
x-enum-elements.description: Generic error - the given location does not matching what is expected.

x-enum-elements.name: IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_REUSED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided idempotency key has already been used.

x-enum-elements.name: UNEXPECTED_VALUE
x-enum-elements.description: General error - the value provided was unexpected.

x-enum-elements.name: SANDBOX_NOT_SUPPORTED
x-enum-elements.description: The API request is not supported in sandbox.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS
x-enum-elements.description: The provided email address is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_PHONE_NUMBER
x-enum-elements.description: The provided phone number is invalid.

x-enum-elements.name: CHECKOUT_EXPIRED
x-enum-elements.description: The provided checkout URL has expired.

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_CERTIFICATE
x-enum-elements.description: Bad certificate.

x-enum-elements.name: INVALID_SQUARE_VERSION_FORMAT
x-enum-elements.description: The provided Square-Version is incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: API_VERSION_INCOMPATIBLE
x-enum-elements.description: The provided Square-Version is incompatible with the requested action.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_DECLINED
x-enum-elements.description: The card was declined.

x-enum-elements.name: VERIFY_CVV_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The CVV could not be verified.

x-enum-elements.name: VERIFY_AVS_FAILURE
x-enum-elements.description: The AVS could not be verified.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_DECLINED_CALL_ISSUER
x-enum-elements.description:
The payment card was declined with a request
for the card holder to call the issuer.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_DECLINED_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED
x-enum-elements.description:
The payment card was declined with a request
for additional verification.

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_EXPIRATION
x-enum-elements.description:
The card expiration date is either missing or
incorrectly formatted.

x-enum-elements.name: CHIP_INSERTION_REQUIRED
x-enum-elements.description:

using a chip reader.

x-enum-elements.name: ALLOWABLE_PIN_TRIES_EXCEEDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The card has exhausted its available pin entry
retries set by the card issuer. Resolving the error typically requires the
card holder to contact the card issuer.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVATION_DECLINED
x-enum-elements.description: The card issuer declined the refund.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_FOUND

x-enum-elements.name: APPLE_PAYMENT_PROCESSING_CERTIFICATE_HASH_NOT_FOUND
x-enum-elements.description: Square could not find the associated Apple Pay certificate.

x-enum-elements.name: METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
x-enum-elements.description: Method Not Allowed - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_ACCEPTABLE
x-enum-elements.description: Not Acceptable - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: REQUEST_TIMEOUT
x-enum-elements.description: Request Timeout - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: CONFLICT
x-enum-elements.description: Conflict - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: GONE
x-enum-elements.description:
The target resource is no longer available and this
condition is likely to be permanent.

x-enum-elements.name: REQUEST_ENTITY_TOO_LARGE
x-enum-elements.description: Request Entity Too Large - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE
x-enum-elements.description: Unsupported Media Type - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY
x-enum-elements.description: Unprocessable Entity - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: RATE_LIMITED

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_IMPLEMENTED
x-enum-elements.description: Not Implemented - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: BAD_GATEWAY

x-enum-elements.name: SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
x-enum-elements.description: Service Unavailable - a general error occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: TEMPORARY_ERROR
x-enum-elements.description:
A temporary internal error occurred. You can safely retry your call
using the same idempotency key.

x-enum-elements.name: GATEWAY_TIMEOUT
x-enum-elements.description: Gateway Timeout - a general error occurred.

ErrorCode.description:
Indicates the specific error that occurred during a request to a
Square API.

x-enum-elements.name: LEAST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The least expensive matched products are excluded from the pricing. If
the pricing rule is set to exclude one product and multiple products in the
match set qualify as least expensive, then one will be excluded at random.

Excluding the least expensive product gives the best discount value to the buyer.

x-enum-elements.name: MOST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The most expensive matched product is excluded from the pricing rule.
If multiple products have the same price and all qualify as least expensive,
one will be excluded at random.

This guarantees that the most expensive product is purchased at full price.

ExcludeStrategy.description:
Indicates which products matched by a CatalogPricingRule
will be excluded if the pricing rule uses an exclude set.

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller determined suspicious activity by the buyer.

x-enum-elements.name: BALANCE_ACCIDENTALLY_INCREASED
x-enum-elements.description: The seller previously increased the gift card balance by accident.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORT_ISSUE
x-enum-elements.description:
The seller decreased the gift card balance to 
accommodate support issues.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLIMENTARY
x-enum-elements.description: Seller gifted a complimentary gift card balance increase.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORT_ISSUE
x-enum-elements.description:
The seller increased the gift card balance 
to accommodate support issues.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSACTION_VOIDED
x-enum-elements.description: The transaction is voided.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_BLOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is blocked because the buyer initiated a chargeback on the gift card purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller suspects suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: REUSE_GIFTCARD
x-enum-elements.description: The seller cleared the balance to reuse the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_REASON
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card balance was cleared for an unknown reason.

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller suspects suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_REASON
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card deactivated for an unknown reason.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_DEACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description: A chargeback on the gift card purchase (or the gift card load) was ruled in favor of the buyer.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description: Activated a gift card with a balance.

x-enum-elements.name: LOAD
x-enum-elements.description: Loaded a gift card with additional funds.

x-enum-elements.name: REDEEM
x-enum-elements.description: Redeemed a gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: CLEAR_BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description: Cleared a gift card balance to zero.

x-enum-elements.name: DEACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description:
Permanently blocked a gift card from a balance-changing 
activity.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_INCREMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Manually increased a gift card balance.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_DECREMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Manually decreased a gift card balance.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Added money to a gift card because a transaction 
paid with this gift card was refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_ACTIVITY_REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Added money to a gift card because a transaction 
not linked to this gift card was refunded
to this gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description: Imported a third-party gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: BLOCK
x-enum-elements.description:
Temporarily blocked a gift card from balance-changing 
activities.

x-enum-elements.name: UNBLOCK
x-enum-elements.description: Unblocked a gift card. It can resume balance-changing activities.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT_REVERSAL
x-enum-elements.description:
A third-party gift card was imported with a balance. 
The import is reversed.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_UNBLOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is unblocked because a chargeback was ruled in favor of the seller.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card account number (GAN) is generated by Square.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card account number (GAN) is imported from a non-Square system. 
For more information, see 
[Third-party gift cards](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/gift-cards/using-gift-cards-api#third-party-gift-cards).

GiftCardGANSource.description:
Indicates the source that generated the gift card 
account number (GAN).

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is active and can be used as a payment source.

x-enum-elements.name: DEACTIVATED
x-enum-elements.description: Any activity that changes the gift card balance is permanently forbidden.

x-enum-elements.name: BLOCKED
x-enum-elements.description: Any activity that changes the gift card balance is temporarily forbidden.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card is pending activation.
This is the state when a gift card is initially created. You must activate the gift card
before you can use it.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL
x-enum-elements.description: A plastic gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: DIGITAL
x-enum-elements.description: A digital gift card.

InlineTypes.description: Object types to inline under their respective parent object in certain connect v2 responses

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The variation does not display an alert.

x-enum-elements.name: LOW_QUANTITY
x-enum-elements.description: The variation generates an alert when its quantity is low.

InventoryAlertType.description: Indicates whether Square should alert the merchant when the inventory quantity of a CatalogItemVariation is low.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL_COUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of a physical count update.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUSTMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
The change occurred as part of the normal lifecycle of goods
(e.g., as an inventory adjustment).

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSFER
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of an inventory transfer.

InventoryChangeType.description: Indicates how the inventory change was applied to a tracked product quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are in a custom state. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_STOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items are on hand and available for sale.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold as part of an itemized
transaction. Quantities in the `SOLD` state are no longer tracked.

x-enum-elements.name: RETURNED_BY_CUSTOMER
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned through the Square Point
of Sale application, but are not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVED_FOR_SALE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are on hand, but not currently
available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD_ONLINE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold online. **READ-ONLY**: the
Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDERED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were ordered from a vendor but not yet
received. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or
from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIVED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were received from a vendor but are
not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_TRANSIT_TO
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are in transit between locations.
*READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this
state.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description:
A placeholder indicating that the related quantity of items are not
currently tracked in Square. Transferring quantities from the `NONE` state
to a tracked state (e.g., `IN_STOCK`) introduces stock into the system.

x-enum-elements.name: WASTE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are lost or damaged and cannot be
sold.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_RETURN
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned but not linked to a
previous transaction. Unlinked returns are not tracked in Square.
Transferring a quantity from `UNLINKED_RETURN` to a tracked state (e.g.,
`IN_STOCK`) introduces new stock into the system.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items that are part of a composition consisting one or more components.

x-enum-elements.name: DECOMPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items that are part of a component.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORTED_BY_NEWER_VERSION
x-enum-elements.description: This state is not supported by this version of the Square API. We recommend that you upgrade the client to use the appropriate version of the Square API supporting this state.

InventoryState.description: Indicates the state of a tracked item quantity in the lifecycle of goods.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: An automatic payment is not configured for the payment request.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Use a card on file as the automatic payment method. On the due date, Square charges the card
for the amount of the payment request.

For `CARD_ON_FILE` payments, the invoice delivery method must be `EMAIL` and `card_id` must be
specified for the payment request before the invoice can be published.

x-enum-elements.name: BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Use a bank account on file as the automatic payment method. On the due date, Square charges the bank
account for the amount of the payment request.

This payment method applies only to recurring invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard or other
Square first-party applications. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. 

You cannot set `BANK_ON_FILE` as a payment method using the Invoices API, but you can change a `BANK_ON_FILE`
payment method to `NONE` or `CARD_ON_FILE`. For `BANK_ON_FILE` payments, the invoice delivery method must be `EMAIL`.

InvoiceAutomaticPaymentSource.description: Indicates the automatic payment method for an [invoice payment request](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/InvoicePaymentRequest).

x-enum-elements.name: ABOVE_LINE_ITEMS
x-enum-elements.description: Render the custom field above the invoice line items.

x-enum-elements.name: BELOW_LINE_ITEMS
x-enum-elements.description: Render the custom field below the invoice line items.

InvoiceCustomFieldPlacement.description:
Indicates where to render a custom field on the Square-hosted invoice page and in emailed or PDF 
copies of the invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description: Directs Square to send invoices, reminders, and receipts to the customer using email.

x-enum-elements.name: SHARE_MANUALLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to take no action on the invoice. In this case, the seller
or application developer follows up with the customer for payment. For example,
a seller might collect a payment in the Seller Dashboard or Point of Sale (POS) application.
The seller might also share the URL of the Square-hosted invoice page (`public_url`) with the customer to request payment.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices and receipts to the customer using SMS (text message).

You cannot set `SMS` as a delivery method using the Invoices API, but you can change an `SMS` delivery method to `EMAIL` or `SHARE_MANUALLY`.

InvoiceDeliveryMethod.description: Indicates how Square delivers the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/Invoice) to the customer.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The reminder will be sent on the `relative_scheduled_date` (if the invoice is published).

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
x-enum-elements.description:
The reminder is not applicable and is not sent. The following are examples
of when reminders are not applicable and are not sent:
- You schedule a reminder to be sent before the invoice is published.
- The invoice is configured with multiple payment requests and a payment request reminder
is configured to be sent after the next payment request `due_date`.
- Two reminders (for different payment requests) are configured to be sent on the
same date. Therefore, only one reminder is sent.
- You configure a reminder to be sent on the date that the invoice is scheduled to be sent.
- The payment request is already paid.
- The invoice status is `CANCELED` or `FAILED`.

x-enum-elements.name: SENT
x-enum-elements.description: The reminder is sent.

InvoicePaymentReminderStatus.description: The status of a payment request reminder.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices, reminders, and receipts to the customer using email.
Square sends the invoice after it is published (either immediately or at the `scheduled_at`
time, if specified in the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/Invoice)).

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the card on file on the `due_date` specified in the payment request
and to use email to send invoices, reminders, and receipts.

x-enum-elements.name: SHARE_MANUALLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to take no specific action on the invoice. In this case, the seller 
(or the application developer) follows up with the customer for payment. For example, 
a seller might collect a payment in the Seller Dashboard or use the Point of Sale (POS) application. 
The seller might also share the URL of the Square-hosted invoice page (`public_url`) with the customer requesting payment.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the bank account on file on the `due_date` specified in the
payment request and to use email to send invoices, reminders, and receipts.

The bank on file payment method applies only to recurring invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard or other
Square first-party applications. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. You 
cannot set `CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices and receipts to the customer using SMS (text message). Square sends the invoice
after it is published (either immediately or at the `scheduled_at` time, if specified in the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/Invoice)). 

You cannot set `SMS` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS_CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the card on file on the `due_date` specified in the payment request and to
use SMS (text message) to send invoices and receipts. 

You cannot set `SMS_CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS_CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the bank account on file on the `due_date` specified in the payment request
and to use SMS (text message) to send invoices and receipts. 

The bank on file payment method applies only to recurring invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard
or other Square first-party applications. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. 
You cannot set `SMS_CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

InvoiceRequestMethod.description:
Specifies the action for Square to take for processing the invoice. For example, 
email the invoice, charge a customer's card on file, or do nothing. DEPRECATED at
version 2021-01-21. The corresponding `request_method` field is replaced by the
`Invoice.delivery_method` and `InvoicePaymentRequest.automatic_payment_source` fields.

x-enum-elements.name: BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for a balance payment. The balance amount is computed as follows: 

- If the invoice specifies only a balance payment request, the balance amount is the 
total amount of the associated order. 
- If the invoice also specifies a deposit request, the balance amount is the amount 
remaining after the deposit.

`INSTALLMENT` and `BALANCE` payment requests are not allowed in the same invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: DEPOSIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for a deposit payment. You have the option of specifying 
an exact amount or a percentage of the total order amount. If you request a deposit, 
it must be due before any other payment requests.

x-enum-elements.name: INSTALLMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for an installment payment. Installments allow buyers to pay the invoice over time. Installments can optionally be combined with a deposit. 

Adding `INSTALLMENT` payment requests to an invoice requires an 
[Invoices Plus subscription](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/overview#invoices-plus-subscription).

InvoiceRequestType.description:
Indicates the type of the payment request. For more information, see 
[Payment requests](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/overview#payment-requests).

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICE_SORT_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The field works as follows:

- If the invoice is a draft, it uses the invoice `created_at` date.
- If the invoice is scheduled for publication, it uses the `scheduled_at` date.
- If the invoice is published, it uses the invoice publication date.

InvoiceSortField.description: The field to use for sorting.

x-enum-elements.name: DRAFT
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is a draft. You must publish a draft invoice before Square can process it.
A draft invoice has no `public_url`, so it is not available to customers.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPAID
x-enum-elements.description: The invoice is published but not yet paid.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is scheduled to be processed. On the scheduled date,
Square sends the invoice, initiates an automatic payment, or takes no action, depending on
the delivery method and payment request settings. Square also sets the invoice status to the
appropriate state: `UNPAID`, `PAID`, `PARTIALLY_PAID`, or `PAYMENT_PENDING`.

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_PAID
x-enum-elements.description: A partial payment is received for the invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID
x-enum-elements.description: The customer paid the invoice in full.

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is paid (or partially paid) and some but not all the amount paid is
refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description: The full amount that the customer paid for the invoice is refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is canceled. Square no longer requests payments from the customer.
The `public_url` page remains and is accessible, but it displays the invoice
as canceled and does not accept payment.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: Square canceled the invoice due to suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_PENDING
x-enum-elements.description:
A payment on the invoice was initiated but has not yet been processed.

When in this state, invoices cannot be updated and other payments cannot be initiated.

InvoiceStatus.description: Indicates the status of an invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The job does not have a defined pay type.

x-enum-elements.name: HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays an hourly rate.

x-enum-elements.name: SALARY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays an annual salary.

JobAssignmentPayType.description: Enumerates the possible pay types that a job can be assigned.

x-enum-elements.name: CREDIT_CARD_PROCESSING
x-enum-elements.description:
The permission to process credit card transactions with Square.

The location can process credit cards if this value is present
in the `capabilities` array of the `Location`.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTOMATIC_TRANSFERS
x-enum-elements.description:
The capability to receive automatic transfers from Square.

The location can receive automatic transfers of their balance from Square if this value
is present in the `capabilities` array of the `Location`.

LocationCapability.description: The capabilities a location may have.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: A location that is active for business.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
A location that is not active for business. Inactive locations just provide historical
information, so typically clients limit interaction with or hide these locations.

LocationStatus.description: The status of the location, whether a location is active or inactive.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business with a physical location.

x-enum-elements.name: MOBILE
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business that is mobile, such as a food truck or online store.

LocationType.description: A location's physical or mobile type.

x-enum-elements.name: PHONE
x-enum-elements.description: The loyalty account is mapped by phone.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE
x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by the Square Point of Sale (POS).

x-enum-elements.name: LOYALTY_API
x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by something other than the Square Point of Sale that used the Loyalty API.

LoyaltyEventSource.description: Defines whether the event was generated by the Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCUMULATE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description: Points are added to a loyalty account for a purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATE_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description:
A loyalty reward is created. For more information, see  
[Loyalty rewards](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/loyalty-api/overview/#loyalty-overview-loyalty-rewards).

x-enum-elements.name: REDEEM_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description: A loyalty reward is redeemed.

x-enum-elements.name: DELETE_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description: A loyalty reward is deleted.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description: Loyalty points are manually adjusted.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Loyalty points are expired according to the 
expiration policy of the loyalty program.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description: Some other loyalty event occurred.

LoyaltyEventType.description: The type of the loyalty event.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A visit-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points for each visit. 
You can specify the minimum purchase required.

x-enum-elements.name: SPEND
x-enum-elements.description:
A spend-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points based on the amount 
spent.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item variation. For example, accrue 
points for purchasing a coffee.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item category. For example, accrue points 
for purchasing any item in the "hot drink" category: coffee, tea, or hot cocoa.

LoyaltyProgramAccrualRuleType.description: The type of the accrual rule that defines how buyers can earn points.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies to the entire order.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to specific item variations.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to items in the given categories.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionScope.description:
Indicates the scope of the reward tier. DEPRECATED at version 2020-12-16. Discount details
are now defined using a catalog pricing rule and other catalog objects. For more information, see
[Get discount details for the reward](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/loyalty-api/overview#get-discount-details).

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The fixed amount discounted.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: The fixed percentage discounted.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionType.description:
The type of discount the reward tier offers. DEPRECATED at version 2020-12-16. Discount details
are now defined using a catalog pricing rule and other catalog objects. For more information, see
[Get discount details for the reward](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/loyalty-api/overview#get-discount-details).

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty program does not have an active subscription. 
Loyalty API requests fail.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The program is fully functional. The program has an active subscription.

LoyaltyProgramStatus.description: Indicates whether the program is currently active.

x-enum-elements.name: ISSUED

x-enum-elements.description:

x-enum-elements.description:
A fulfillment to be picked up from a physical [location](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2021-08-18/objects/Location)

x-enum-elements.description: A fulfillment to be shipped by a shipping carrier.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_DISCOUNT_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The discount should be applied to only line items specified by
`OrderLineItemAppliedDiscount` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemDiscountScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line-item or order-level discount.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_DISCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed percentage (such as 5%) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed monetary value (such as $1.00) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable percentage based on the item
price.

The specific discount percentage of a `VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable amount based on the item price.

The specific discount amount of a `VARIABLE_AMOUNT` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

OrderLineItemDiscountType.description: Indicates how the discount is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the line item is an itemized sale.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the line item is a non-itemized sale.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the line item is a gift card sale. Gift cards sold through
the Orders API are sold in an unactivated state and can be activated through the
Gift Cards API using the line item `uid`.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TAX_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax should be applied only to line items specified by
the `OrderLineItemAppliedTax` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The tax should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemTaxScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line-item or order-level tax.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_TAX
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the price.
For example, an item with a cost of 1.00 USD and a 10% additive tax has a total
cost to the buyer of 1.10 USD.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an inclusive tax. Inclusive taxes are already included
in the line item price or order total. For example, an item with a cost of
1.00 USD and a 10% inclusive tax has a pretax cost of 0.91 USD
(91 cents) and a 0.09 (9 cents) tax for a total cost of 1.00 USD to
the buyer.

OrderLineItemTaxType.description: Indicates how the tax is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: SUBTOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is applied after discounts, but before
taxes.

x-enum-elements.name: TOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is applied after all discounts and taxes
are applied.

OrderServiceChargeCalculationPhase.description:
Represents a phase in the process of calculating order totals.
Service charges are applied after the indicated phase.

[Read more about how order totals are calculated.](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/how-it-works#how-totals-are-calculated)

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the order is completed. Completed orders are fully paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the order is canceled. Canceled orders are not paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: CREATED_AT
